source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Stems procumbent; leaf-blades flat; inflorescence with lower branches mostly more than 2 cm long and often spreading; fertile lemma subequal to or up to c. 1 mm shorter than sterile lemma
Stems mostly erect, often much-branched; leaf-blades involute; inflorescence with branches less than 2 cm long, not spreading, or unbranched; fertile lemma subequal or equal to sterile lemma
